channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Retail sales jump as people rush to buy cars ahead of tariffs
item.description: The key driver of the economy saw the biggest increase in over two years in March, as car buyers tried to get ahead of President Trump's tariffs on im...

item.title: Could polio be poised for a comeback?
item.description: Cases have been rising in Afghanistan and Pakistan — and global health specialists are worried that this year's U.S. foreign aid cuts could usher in a...

item.title: Trump aims to lower drug prices. And, Harvard's tax-exempt status threatened
item.description: Trump has signed an executive action aimed at lowering prescription drug prices. And, the president threatened to revoke Harvard University's tax-exem...

item.title: Study highlights cancer risk from millions of CT scans performed annually
item.description: They can be life-saving but radiation from the scans also contributes to cancer risk. The authors of a new study estimate overuse of CT scans is incre...

item.title: China reports 5.4% GDP growth in 1st quarter, but analysts say tariffs will bite soon
item.description: Growth was driven partly by strong industrial activity and exports, before President Trump's punishing tariffs. Experts say these levies will hurt Chi...

item.title: Mar 12: CBS News 24/7, 10am ET
item.description: Inflation rate hits 2.8% in February, less than expected; SpaceX Crew 10 mission set for launch, could pave way for return of Starliner astronauts.

item.title: French row with Algeria escalates further with tit-for-tat expulsions
item.description: France recalls its ambassador to Algeria and orders 12 Algerian diplomats to leave as tensions continue to rise.

item.title: The Oklahoma City bombing was 30 years ago. Some survivors worry America didn’t learn the lesson
WHO agrees legally binding pandemic treaty
item.description: The agreement is designed to ensure more cooperation between nations in the event of another pandemic.

item.title: AP Was There: A truck bomb rips through a federal building in Oklahoma City in 1995
Nvidia shares plunge amid $5.5bn hit over export rules to China
item.description: The chip manufacturing giant will require licences to export its H20 AI chip to China.

item.title: 25 U.S. cities where a $100,000 a year isn't enough to get by anymore
item.description: In these major U.S. cities, a family of three earning $100,000 would have a hard time covering basic expenses.

item.title: Peru's ex-president and first lady sentenced to 15 years in jail
item.description: A court ruled that Humala, who governed Peru from 2011 to 2016, took illegal campaign contributions.

item.title: Husband and wife arrested 24 years after man found dead in his truck
item.description: Police did not say what led them to arrest the couple, but both have been charged with murder and are in custody.

item.title: Mar 12: CBS News 24/7, 1pm ET
item.description: Trump's 25% tariffs on steel and aluminum take effect, prompting EU and Canada to retaliate; NASA set to bring astronauts home after eight-day mission...

item.title: Trump administration sues Maine over participation of transgender athletes in girls sports
item.description: The Trump administration is suing Maine’s education department for not complying with its push to ban transgender athletes in girls and women’s sports...

item.title: Autism rate rises to 3% of children in CDC study
item.description: CDC experts were not made available to discuss the findings showing a rise in autism prevalence.

item.title: Peru's ex-president and first lady sentenced to 15 years in jail
item.description: A court ruled that Humala, who governed Peru from 2011 to 2016, took illegal campaign contributions.
